parse.title: List of terrorist incidents in June 2019

wikitext.*:
{{For|other incidents in 2019, and an outline of what is excluded from or included in this list|List of terrorist incidents in 2019}} This is a list of some of the [[terrorist]], alleged terrorist or suspected terrorist incidents which took place in June 2019, including incidents by [[violent non-state actor]]s for political, religious, or ideological motives. == Guidelines == *To be included, entries must be [[Notability in the English Wikipedia|notable]] (have a stand-alone article) and described by a consensus of [[WP:Reliable sources|reliable sources]] as "terrorism". *List entries must comply with the guidelines outlined in the manual of style under [[MOS:TERRORIST]]. *Casualties figures in this list are the total casualties of the incident including immediate casualties and later casualties (such as people who succumbed to their wounds long after the attacks occurred). *Casualties listed are the victims. Perpetrator casualties are listed separately (e.g. ''x (+y)'' indicate that ''x'' victims and ''y'' perpetrators were killed/injured). *Casualty totals may be underestimated or unavailable due to a lack of information. A figure with a plus (+) sign indicates that at least that many people have died (e.g. 10+ indicates that at least 10 people have died) – the actual toll could be considerably higher. A figure with a plus (+) sign may also indicate that over that number of people are victims. *If casualty figures are 20 or more, they will be shown in '''bold'''. In addition, figures for casualties more than 50 will also be '''underlined'''. *Incidents are limited to one per location per day. If multiple attacks occur in the same place on the same day, they will be merged into a single incident. *In addition to the guidelines above, the table also includes the following categories: ::{{legend|#E0FFFF|0 people were killed/injured by the incident.}} ::{{legend|#B6FCB6|1–19 people were killed/injured by the incident.}} ::{{legend|#FFFF66|20–49 people were killed/injured by the incident.}} ::{{legend|#FED8B1|50–99 people were killed/injured by the incident.}} ::{{legend|#FA8072|100+ people were killed/injured by the incident.}} ==List== Total incidents: {{table row counter|id=terrorIncidents2019June|ignore=1}} {| class="wikitable sortable" id="terrorIncidents2019June" |- !Date !Type !data-sort-type="number" | Dead !data-sort-type="number" | Injured !Location ! class="unsortable" |Details !Perpetrator !Part of
|- |2 |Car bombing |style="background:#FFFF66;text-align:left"|'''22''' |style="background:#FFFF66;text-align:left"|'''45''' |[[Azaz]], Syria |'''[[June 2019 Syria attacks]]''': 22 civilians were killed and over 45 wounded in a car bomb attack near a market and a mosque in the city of [[Azaz]] in northern Syria.{{Cite news|url=http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/car-bombing-kills-at-least-21-in-syrias-azaz-monitor-143925|title=Car bombing kills at least 21 in Syria's Azaz: Monitor|publisher=Hurriyet Daily News|accessdate=2019-06-03}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.gulftoday.ae/news/2019/06/03/car-bombing-kills-19-in-syrias-azaz-monitor|title=Car bombing kills 19 in Syria's Azaz: Monitor|publisher=Gulf Today|accessdate=2019-06-03}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.yenisafak.com/en/world/dozens-killed-in-bomb-attack-in-northwestern-syria-3482492|title=Dozens killed in bomb attack in northwestern Syria|publisher=Yeni Safak|accessdate=2019-06-03}}{{Cite news|url=https://aawsat.com/english/home/article/1751631/least-17-killed-bombing-syria’s-azaz|title=At Least 17 Killed in Bombing in Syria's Azaz|publisher=Asharq Al-Awsat|accessdate=2019-06-03}}{{Cite news|url=https://syrianobserver.com/EN/news/50875/number-of-victims-of-azaz-bombing-rises-to-22.html|title=Number of Victims of Azaz Bombing Rises to 22|publisher=Syrian Observer|accessdate=2019-06-04}} |[[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant|Islamic State]] |[[Syrian Civil War]] |- |2 |Shooting, assassination |style="background:#b6fcb6;text-align:left"|1 |style="background:#E0FFFF;text-align:left"|0 |[[Kassel (district)|Kassel]], Germany |The [[Christian Democratic Union of Germany|CDU]] politician [[Walter Lübcke]] was shot dead in front of his residence in [[Wolfhagen]], Kassel. A suspect from the far-right milieu was arrested. Lübcke was well known for his pro-migrant views. Authorities suspect the incident to be a right-wing attack.{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/jun/16/suspect-in-german-politicians-has-links-to-far-right|title=Suspect in German politician's murder 'has links to far right'|date=16 June 2019|work=The Guardian}}{{cite web|url=https://www.t-online.de/nachrichten/id_85941628/fall-luebcke-bundesanwaltschaft-geht-von-rechtsextremem-anschlag-aus.html|title=Getöteter Politiker Walter Lübcke: Bundesanwaltschaft geht von rechtsextremem Anschlag aus|date=17 June 2019|work=T-Online|language=German}}{{cite news|url=https://www.spiegel.de/panorama/justiz/walter-luebcke-verdaechtiger-hatte-offenbar-kontakt-zu-militanten-neonazis-a-1272817.html|title= Erschossener CDU-Politiker Lübcke: Verdächtiger hatte offenbar Kontakt zu militanten Neonazis von "Combat 18"|date=17 June 2019|newspaper=Spiegel Online|language=German}} |[[Combat 18]] |[[Terrorism in Germany]] |- |3 |Bombing, shooting |style="background:#b6fcb6;text-align:left"|4 (+1) |style="background:#E0FFFF;text-align:left"|0 |[[Tripoli, Lebanon|Tripoli]], Lebanon |'''[[2019 Tripoli shooting]]''': A militant attacked a security patrol in Tripoli, Lebanon, with a bomb and then opened fire killing two policemen and two soldiers. The attacker then detonated his explosives after he was holed up in a building. He had previously been charged for belonging to the Islamic State.{{Cite news|url=https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-lebanon-security/militant-attack-kills-two-police-two-soldiers-in-lebanons-tripoli-idUKKCN1T42RG|title=Militant kills two police, two soldiers in Lebanon's Tripoli|publisher=Reuters|accessdate=2019-06-04}} |[[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant|Islamic State]] |[[List of attacks in Lebanon|Terrorism in Lebanon]] |- |3–10 |Shooting, melee attack, stabbing, vehicular attack |style="background:#FA8072;text-align:left"|'''118''' |style="background:#FA8072;text-align:left"|'''650+''' |[[Khartoum]], Sudan |'''[[Khartoum massacre]]''': Unarmed protestors were attacked by security forces and paramilitary forces during a sit-in. The opposition says 118 people were killed, but the authorities put the death toll at 62. The exact number of deaths is difficult to say because a lot of bodies were dumped in the [[Nile]]. Hundreds of people became injured and a lot of people were raped. More people were killed in violence the next days across the country.{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/jun/05/sudan-death-toll-rises-to-60-after-khartoum-pro-democracy-sit-in|title=Sudan paramilitaries threw dead protesters into Nile, doctors say|work=The Guardian|accessdate=2019-06-21}}{{Cite news|url=https://edition.cnn.com/2019/06/03/africa/sudan-gunfire-khartoum-intl/index.html|title=At least 35 killed as Sudan military storms Khartoum sit-in|publisher=CNN|accessdate=2019-06-21}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-48535165|title=Sudan crisis: Official admits to 46 protest deaths|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=2019-06-21}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.middleeasteye.net/news/sudan-names-100-killed-deadly-week|title=Sudan: The names of 100 people killed in a week of deadly violence|publisher=Middle East Eye|accessdate=2019-06-21}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-sudan-politics-crackdown/sudan-sit-in-bloodshed-cripples-uprising-idUSKCN1TB1VK|title=Sudan sit-in bloodshed cripples uprising|publisher=Reuters|accessdate=2019-06-21}} |[[Transitional Military Council (2019)|TMC security forces]], [[Rapid Support Forces (Sudan)|RSF]] |[[2018–19 Sudanese protests]] |- |10 |Shooting |style="background:#FFFF66;text-align:left"|'''35''' |style="background:#EAECF0;text-align:left"|Unknown |[[Mopti Region]], Mali |'''[[Sobane Da massacre]]''': About 50 heavily armed men surrounded and attacked the village of Sobane-Kou in central Mali. It was inhabited by people belonging to the [[Dogon people|Dogon]] ethnic group. The government has suspected a terrorist group but an official has blamed a Fulani militia. 95 bodies were claimed to have been found, but 19 people were still missing.{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-48579475|title=Attack on Mali village 'kills 100'|publisher=BBC NEws|date=2019-06-10|access-date=2019-06-10}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-48595541|title=More than 100 villagers safe despite Mali attack |date=2019-06-11|publisher=BBC News |access-date=2019-06-11}} The toll was based on claims of soldiers and the district mayor. Mali government revised it to 35 after a personal count by an expert team, the confusion being due to those who fled.{{cite web|url=https://news.yahoo.com/massacre-toll-mali-revised-down-35-153116963.html|title=Massacre toll in Mali revised down to 35|publisher=Yahoo! News|accessdate=11 June 2019}} |[[Fulani]] [[militia]] or jihadists (suspected) |[[Northern Mali conflict]] |- |10–17 |Shooting, attacks, massacres |style="background:#FA8072;text-align:left"|'''240+''' |style="background:#EAECF0;text-align:left"|Unknown |[[Ituri Province]], Democratic Republic of the Congo |Over 240 people were killed in attacks on villages and communities and ethnic clashes between Lendu and Hema tribes in the volatile Ituri Province. The attackers were mostly from the Lendu tribe, with the attacks primarily targeting Hema civilians, but police officers were also targeted. According to reports. the attacks on Hema villagers were in response to the killing of four Lendu businessmen on June 10, which the Lendu considered to be assassinations by Hema militiamen. 160 bodies were found in a mass grave in the village of Tche, with others found elsewhere.{{Cite news|url=https://www.vanguardngr.com/2019/06/fighting-kills-at-least-50-eastern-dr-congo/|title=Fighting kills at least 50 eastern DR Congo |publisher=Vanguard Nigeria|accessdate=2019-06-14}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/06/scores-dead-revenge-attacks-dr-congo-190616174901617.html |title=Scores dead from revenge attacks in DR Congo|publisher=Al Jazeera|accessdate=2019-06-17}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.iol.co.za/news/africa/at-least-161-dead-in-northeast-drc-in-apparent-ethnic-clashes-26511624|title=At least 161 dead in northeast DRC in apparent ethnic clashes|publisher=IOL|accessdate=2019-06-17}}{{Cite news|url=https://in.reuters.com/article/congo-violence/at-least-161-dead-in-northeast-congo-in-apparent-ethnic-clashes-idINKCN1TI1FR?rpc=401&|title=At least 161 dead in northeast Congo in apparent ethnic clashes|publisher=Reuters|accessdate=2019-06-17}}{{Cite news|url=https://af.reuters.com/article/commoditiesNews/idAFL8N23P68Y|title=UPDATE 1-Survivors recall horror of Congo ethnic attacks|publisher=Reuters|accessdate=2019-06-27}} |[[Lendu people|Lendu]] and [[Hema people|Hema]] militias |[[Ituri conflict]] |- |12 |Rocket attack |style="background:#E0FFFF;text-align:left"|0 |style="background:#FFFF66;text-align:left"|'''26''' |[[Abha]], Saudi Arabia |'''[[Abha International Airport attack]]''': A Houthi-fired rocket landed in the arrivals hall of the [[Abha International Airport]], injuring over two dozen civilians.{{Cite news|url=https://thedefensepost.com/2019/06/12/yemen-houthis-attack-abha-airport-saudi-arabia/|title=Yemen's Houthi rebels attack Saudi Arabia's Abha airport, injuring dozens|publisher=The Defense Post|accessdate=2019-06-16}} |[[Houthi movement]] |[[Yemeni Civil War (2015–present)|Yemeni Civil War]] |- |12 |Shooting |style="background:#b6fcb6;text-align:left"|6 (+1) |style="background:#b6fcb6;text-align:left"|3 |[[Anantnag]], India |Six paramilitary soldiers were killed when they were attacked by two militants while patrolling the streets. Two soldiers and a police officer became injured. The soldiers shot back, and killed one of the attackers.{{cite web|url=http://risingkashmir.com/news/anantnag-gunfight-top-jem-commander-among-two-militants-killed|title=Anantnag gunfight: Top JeM commander among two militants killed|work=Rising Kashmir|accessdate=2019-08-12}}{{cite web|url=https://sputniknews.com/asia/201907301076409231-top-jaish-terrorist-wanted-for-killing-6-indian-troops-killed-in-kashmir/|title=Top Jaish Terrorist Wanted for Killing 6 Indian Troops Killed in Kashmir|agency=Sputnik News|accessdate=2019-08-12}} |[[Jaish-e-Mohammad]] |[[Insurgency in Jammu and Kashmir]] |- |16 |Suicide bombings |style="background:#FFFF66;text-align:left"|'''30''' (+3) |style="background:#FFFF66;text-align:left"|'''40+''' |[[Konduga]], Nigeria |'''[[2019 Borno bombings]]''': 30 civilians were killed when three Boko Haram suicide bombers detonated their explosives in the Mandareri-Sambisa ward of the [[Konduga]] Local Government Area in central Borno State. The bombers targeted a crowd of civilians watching a football match.{{Cite news|url=https://dailypost.ng/2019/06/17/boko-haram-14-reported-killed-38-injured-2-suicide-bombers-attack-mandareri-sambisa/|title=Boko Haram: 14 reported killed, 38 injured as 2 suicide bombers attack Mandareri-Sambisa|publisher=Daily Post|accessdate=2019-06-17}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.thebreakingtimes.com/breaking-boko-haram-suicide-bombers-attack-viewing-centre-in-borno-kill-20-injure-many/|title=BREAKING: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers Attack Viewing Centre In Borno, Kill 20, Injure Many|publisher=The Breaking Times|accessdate=2019-06-17}}{{Cite news|url=https://thedefensepost.com/2019/06/17/nigeria-boko-haram-triple-suicide-bombing-konduga/|title=Nigeria: Dozens killed in Boko Haram triple suicide bombing in Konduga, Borno state|publisher=The Defense Post|accessdate=2019-06-17}} |[[Boko Haram]] |[[Boko Haram insurgency]] |- |17 |Shooting |style="background:#e0ffff;text-align:left"|0 (+1) |style="background:#b6fcb6;text-align:left"|1 |[[Dallas]], United States of America |'''[[2019 Dallas Courthouse shooting]]''': A gunman attacked the [[Earle Cabell Federal Building and Courthouse]] in Dallas, [[Texas]], United States. No law enforcement officers or civilians were injured in the shooting, though one person sustained a superficial injury when she was taking cover; the only casualty was the shooter who was shoot dead by the security forces. The gunman appears to have self-radicalized online, posting memes from an [[incel]], extremist [[far right]] memes including ideas about the [[Confederate States of America|Confederate States]] and [[Nazism]], combining eco-friendly and [[libertarian]] ideas with far-right authoritarianism.{{Cite web|url=https://www.kswo.com/2019/06/17/gunman-opens-fire-outside-dallas-federal-building/|title=UPDATE: FBI identifies Dallas federal building shooter|last=Burk|first=Jarred|date=17 June 2019|website=KSWO|language=en-US|access-date=2019-06-18}}{{cite news |last1=Krause |first1=Kevin |title=Dallas’ ‘lone wolf’ shooting shows how we’re always in danger, even with improved security |url=https://www.dallasnews.com/news/crime/2019/06/22/dallas-lone-wolf-shooting-shows-always-danger-even-improved-security |accessdate=30 June 2019 |publisher=Dallas Morning News |date=22 June 2019}}{{cite news |last1=Solomon |first1=Dan |title=How Did the Dallas Courthouse Gunman Get Radicalized? |url=https://www.texasmonthly.com/politics/dallas-courthouse-shooter-brian-clyde-radicalized/ |accessdate=27 June 2019 |publisher=Texas Monthly |date=20 June 2019}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/national/dallas-courthouse-shooter-honorably-discharged-from-army/2019/06/19/d635b38c-92ae-11e9-956a-88c291ab5c38_story.html|title=Dallas courthouse shooter honorably discharged from Army|last=Associated Press|first=|date=19 June 2019|work=The Washington Post|access-date=19 June 2019}} |Bryan Isaack Clyde |[[Terrorism in the United States]] |- |21 |Suicide bombing |style="background:#B6FCB6;text-align:left"|10 (+1) |style="background:#FFFF66;text-align:left"|'''30''' |[[Baghdad]], Iraq |Ten civilians were killed when a suicide bomber detonated his explosive belt in a crowd of worshippers at a [[Shia Islam|Shia]] mosque in eastern Baghdad.{{Cite news|url=https://www.presstv.com/Detail/2019/06/21/599055/bomb-blast-Baghdad-mosque|title=Nearly dozen killed, 30 injured in bomb blast targeting Baghdad mosque|publisher=PressTV|accessdate=2019-06-21}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.yenisafak.com/en/world/mosque-attack-leaves-at-least-10-dead-30-wounded-in-baghdad-3483823|title=Mosque attack leaves at least 10 dead, 30 wounded in Baghdad|publisher=Yeni Safak|accessdate=2019-06-21}} |[[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant|Islamic State]] (suspected) |[[Iraqi insurgency (2017–present)|Iraqi insurgency]] |- |22 |Shooting, assassinations |style="background:#B6FCB6;text-align:left"|13+ |style="background:#E0FFFF;text-align:left"|0 |[[Bahir Dar]] and [[Addis Ababa]], Ethiopia |'''[[Amhara Region coup d'état attempt]]''': Dozens of people were killed during a failed coup d'état by Amhara militias against the regional government. In Bahir Dar the [[Amhara Region]] President [[Ambachew Mekonnen]], his adviser Ezez Wassie and Amharra Region Attorney General Megbaru Kebede were killed in the state offices during a meeting. In Addis Ababa [[Chief of General Staff (Ethiopia)|Chief of Staff]] of the [[Ethiopian National Defense Force]] General [[Se'are Mekonnen]] and a retired general who had been visiting him were killed by a bodyguard. The militias were part of the Amhara Region's Peace and Security Bureau led by Brigadier General [[Asaminew Tsige]], who was shot dead by security forces two days later. |[[Amhara people|Amhara]] militias |[[Amhara Region coup d'état attempt]] |- |28 |Suicide bombings |style="background:#b6fcb6;text-align:left"|6 (+2) |style="background:#FFFF66;text-align:left"|'''22''' |[[Indanan, Sulu|Indanan]], Philippines |'''[[2019 Indanan bombings]]''': 6 people including three soldiers were killed when two suicide bombers attacked a military camp belonging to the army in Indanan, Sulu. The Islamic State group claimed responsibility for the attack and released a photo of the two perpetrators.{{Cite news|url=https://www.rappler.com/nation/234192-isis-claims-responsibility-suicide-attack-military-camp-sulu|title=ISIS claims suicide attack on Sulu military camp|publisher=Rappler|accessdate=2019-06-28}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.khaleejtimes.com/international/rest-of-asia/5-killed-9-wounded-in-philippines-suicide-bomb-attack-|title=5 killed, 9 wounded in Philippines suicide bomb attack|publisher=Khaleejtimes|accessdate=2019-06-28}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.rappler.com//nation/234140-bombing-western-mindanao-command-indanan-sulu-june-28-2019|title=8 killed, 22 wounded in attack on military camp in Sulu|publisher=Rappler|accessdate=2019-06-29}}{{cite web|url=https://www.worldpoliticsreview.com/articles/28054/abu-sayyaf-is-bringing-more-of-isis-brutal-tactics-to-the-philippines|title=Abu Sayyaf Is Bringing More of ISIS' Brutal Tactics to the Philippines|work=World Politics Review|accessdate=2019-08-12}} |[[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant|Islamic State]] (claimed)
[[Abu Sayyaf]] (suspected) |[[Moro conflict]] |- |30 |Suicide car bombings |style="background:#FED8B1;text-align:left"|'''53''' (+4) |style="background:#EAECF0;text-align:left"|Unknown |[[Maruf District]], Afghanistan |Four Taliban insurgents driving Humvees packed with explosives attacked a government compound in the district center of [[Maruf District]] in the southern [[Kandahar Province]] early on Sunday. The explosions killed 53 people, including 8 electoral commission members and 45 police officers.{{Cite news|url=https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-afghanistan-taliban/taliban-kills-eight-election-commission-employees-in-south-afghanistan-officials-idUKKCN1TV09J?rpc=401&|title=Taliban kills eight election commission employees in south Afghanistan – officials|publisher=Reuters|accessdate=2019-06-30}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-afghanistan-taliban/fighting-rages-across-afghanistan-as-peace-talks-continue-idUSKCN1TV0AD|title=Fighting rages across Afghanistan as peace talks continue|publisher=Reuters|accessdate=2019-06-30}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2019/06/30/world/asia/afghanistan-taliban-bombs.html|title=Dozens Killed as Taliban Bombs in 4 Humvees Rip Through Afghan District|work=New York Times|accessdate=2019-06-30}} |[[Taliban]] |[[War in Afghanistan (2001–present)|War in Afghanistan]] |- |} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Lists of Terrorist Incidents}} {{Portal bar|Lists}} [[Category:June 2019 crimes|*Terrorist]] [[Category:Lists of terrorist incidents in 2019|06]]
